grammarNote.title: Giving and Receiving: あげる, もらう, くれる
grammarNote.explanation: Japanese has three verbs for giving/receiving that encode social perspective. あげる: I/someone gives (away from speaker). くれる: someone gives (to speaker/speaker's group — a favor to me). もらう: I/someone receives. These often attach to て-form verbs: 書いてくれる (writes for me), 書いてもらう (I get someone to write). The choice reflects how the speaker views the social relationship.
